histore.document.schema module¶

Columns in histore data frames have a unique identifier and a column name. The column class extends the Python String class to be able to be used as a column value in a Pandas data frame.

class histore.document.schema.Column(colid: int, name: str, colidx: Optional[int] = None)¶

Bases: str

Columns in histore data frames are subclasses of Python strings that contain a unique column identifier. This implementation is based on: https://bytes.com/topic/python/answers/32098-my-experiences-subclassing-string

The order of creation is that the __new__ method is called which returns the object then __init__ is called.

histore.document.schema.as_list(columns: Union[int, str, List[Union[str, int]]]) → List[Union[int, str, histore.document.schema.Column]]¶

Ensure that the given columns argument is a list.

Parameters

columns (int, string, or list(int or string), optional) – Single column or list of column index positions or column names.

Returns

Return type

list

histore.document.schema.column_index(schema: List[Union[str, histore.document.schema.Column]], columns: Union[int, str, List[Union[str, int]]])¶

Get the list of column index positions in a given schema (list of column names). Columns are either specified by name or by index position. The result is a list of column index positions.

Raises errors if invalid columns positions or unknown column names are provided.

Parameters

  • schema (list(string)) – List of column names.

  • columns (int, str, or list(int or str)) – List of column index positions or column names.

Returns

Return type

(list, list)

Raises

ValueError –

histore.document.schema.column_ref(schema: List[Union[str, histore.document.schema.Column]], column: Union[int, str]) → Tuple[str, int]¶

Get the column name and index position for a referenced column in the given schema. Columns may be referenced by their name or index. This function returns both, the name and the index of the referenced column.

Raises a ValueError if an unknown column is referenced.

Parameters

  • schema (list of string) – List of column names in a dataset schema

  • column (int, string, or Column) – Reference to a column in the dataset schema.

Returns

Return type

tuple(string, int)

histore.document.schema.select_clause(schema: List[Union[str, histore.document.schema.Column]], columns: Union[int, str, List[Union[str, int]]]) → Tuple[List[str], List[int]]¶

Get the list of column name objects and index positions in a data frame for list of columns that are specified either by name or by index position.

The result is a tuple containing two lists: the list of column objects and the list of column index positions.

Raises errors if invalid columns positions or unknown column names or types are provided.

Parameters

  • schema (List of string) – List of columns in a dataset schema.

  • columns (int, string or list of int or string) – Single column reference or a list of column index positions or column names.

Returns

Return type

(list, list)

Raises

ValueError –

histore.document.schema.to_schema(columns: Union[int, str, List[Union[str, int]]]) → List[histore.document.schema.Column]¶

Convert a list of column names to a list of column objects.

If all column names are already of type Column no changes will occur. If the given list contains a mix of types an error is raised.

Parameters

columns (list of string) – List of column names.

Returns

Return type

list of histore.document.schema.Column
